noAndYourNetworkIsBad
The system checks the network lag and replies in response to the question "Is ChessUqam lagging?" In this case, it's the user's network connection that is making the game lag.

resources.string: No. And your network is bad.
Yes. It will be fixed soon!
And now, the long answer! Game lag is composed of two unrelated values (lower is better):

The time it takes to process a move on the server. It's the same for everybody, and only depends on the servers load. The more players and the higher it gets, but ChessUqam developers do their best to keep it low. It rarely exceeds 10ms.

The time it takes to send a move from your computer to ChessUqam server, and get the response back. It's specific to your distance to ChessUqam (France), and to the quality of your Internet connection. ChessUqam developers cannot fix your wifi or make light go faster.
You can find both these values at any time, by clicking your username in the top bar.

ChessUqam compensates network lag. This includes sustained lag and occasional lag spikes. There are limits and heuristics based on time control and the compensated lag so far, so that the result should feel reasonable for both players. As a result, having a higher network lag than your opponent is not a handicap!
